Package bin.main.GenomeDatabaseInformation

Class GenomeRanges

  • java.lang.Object
    • bin.main.GenomeDatabaseInformation.GenomeRanges
  • public class GenomeRanges
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods for working with genome ranges.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GenomeRanges​(int chromosome, char arm, int region, int band, int sub_band, int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      This creates a physical range of genomes for reference when trying to create safety for users with less technical knowledge of the actual genome ranges.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenomeRanges

        public GenomeRanges​(int chromosome,
                    char arm,
                    int region,
                    int band,
                    int sub_band,
                    int lowerBound,
                    int upperBound)
             throws GenomeDatabaseError
        This creates a physical range of genomes for reference when trying to create safety for users with less technical knowledge of the actual genome ranges.
        Parameters:
        chromosome - This is the chromosome that we are operating on
        arm - This is the arm the range is on. 'P' is the short arm and "Q' is the long arm.
        region - This is the region of the range. This is the first specification that pinpoints more information.
        band - This is the band. This will be visually seen as black or white when looking at the databases for information.
        sub_band - This sub band is the most specific measurement that we have to pinpoint our operating range. 0 means we have no use for the sub_band.
        lowerBound - This is the lower bound of the range.
        upperBound - This is the upper bound of the range.
        Throws:
        GenomeDatabaseError - We throw an error for the safety of the user so that we only operate on valid ranges and information.

    • Method Detail

      • singleDigit

        public static boolean singleDigit​(int i)
        Single Digit checker effectively so that we make sure that we only have a single digit for some of our inputs.
        Parameters:
        i - The input.
        Returns:
        If true then the input is a singular digit.

      • isPossible

        public boolean isPossible​(int chromosome,
                          int lowerBound,
                          int higherBound)
        Checks if the bounds that we give the information is possible.
        Parameters:
        chromosome - The chromosome that we are operating on.
        lowerBound - The lower bound we are testing.
        higherBound - The upper bound we are testing.
        Returns:
        If TRUE then the range is possible on the chromosome.
